content:
Posted: June 20, 2013
												An incredibly funny and fast-paced platformer, this game is definitely worth more than the $9 I paid for it. Although the campaign is quite short with only 25 missions, there is a lever creator and editor to make your own levels as much as you want. There's also a workshop update, so you can play other players' levels. Also, you can go back and play missions that you've already finished, getting new badges and achievements each time. With fun upgrades like kicking down doors, a handgun and muffling breaking windows, this is worth it.Alright, we're done here.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 13, 2014
												This game is a tricky review since it's sorta a puzzle game but sorta a platformer but also sorta an action game...From the puzzle perspective, your character can edit the electronics so when a guard sees the lights go off, he runs for the switch, flips it on, the switch however calls a lift which upon arriving causes a sound detector to go off which turns off the upstairs lights and when the officer goes to hit the light switch his gun discharges and shoots the person he's patroling with. The entire time your character sindles accross the ceiling like a monkey taking a gymnastic's class.What I found charming was the presence of humor in the game- you could make choices and these choices actually influence the game (not a whole ton, but enough...) for example: one of the achivements would be to solve the police officer's missions without incriminating yourself. How do you do that? You show the officer that there is no way you could have committed the murder you see in the intro.... as well as hide any evidence that says otherwise.Overall though, this is a great game and it will get its money's worth as it has several replays in it before it gets boring. Keep in mind it also has a custom mode where you can create your own levels filled with guards and wall sockets to electicute said guards at the switch of a button... you know, to blow off some steam since they shot you for the 19 billionth time that game...

content:
Posted: October 26, 2014
												I've been playing Gunpoint for a while and I am pretty intrigued so far. It's quite a stealth-based game, but you'll find yourself having to use violence from time to time... or you might as well go full thug. At each end of the mission you'll be rated how much violence/stealth/noise you used. You'll get rewarded money to buy gadgets and the choices you make will influence the story.>I'd give it a 8/10>Pros: Strategic stealth weird mix game, interesting leap technique, story changes based on choices.>Cons: The time to finish levels is so low, yet it takes me 5x more than that.

content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												This is such a brilliant game, I highly recommend this. It has brilliant stealth and hacking mechanics, and the combat is avoidable if you're like me and don't like murdering people who're just doing their jobs. But if you do, there are a host of ways to creatively and entertainingly murder guards. (I don't recommend using the gun, unless you want to deal with a police sniper)Anyway, I feel like doing the thing that everybody else does in reviews, with the chain of events thing.*Got to last level*Took hours to get through it*Accidently killed a pro with a trapdoor*Finally got to the spy*Desperatly clicked "punch" because I didn't want to deal with the cops*Got back to Gessler*Rewired his gun so he didn't shoot me*Accidently kicked a door into him instead of shooting him*Wins anyway*Writes blog post*Writes actual blog post*Fails miserably at trying to make a level*Writes this review

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 31, 2015
												Gunpoint is a nice, short espionage game. Highly replayable, with many ways to tackle missions (nonlethal, lethal, undetected, guns blazing, hacking, etc.). I also love the noir detective feel the game has to it, and the super jumping boots you wear are a nice mechanic. You can feel like a frog jumping from doors and windows to ceilings to pouncing on guards, etc. You also have numerous dialogue options with people as you progress through the story that can change the outcome. It's really something that must be experienced on your own. Gunpoint is probably my favorite indie game, 9.25/10.

												This game is fantastic, just brilliant; in the gameplay, the comedy in the gameplay, the dialogue, the comedy in the dialogue and the music! Oh god the music is good! content:
Posted: November 20, 2014
												About in-game story:It is quite simply presented in conversations between the characters before each stage (and u have the option to choose what to answer although its superficial and most of the time it won't result in different reactions nor change storyline). I got interested in the dialogs, they were fun and I didn't feel like skipping the talks (they are short) nor wanted to rush to the gameplay only.About gameplay:There are various missions in this game and each get more challenging, and the fun in Gunpoint is to solve them with the stealth/puzzle system present in it, which is pretty amazing. About etc:Controls are very simple, graphics are even simpler, and the music is just very relaxing (jazz).  Only came across a bug once where i got through a locked door I had no means of passing yet. Sadly, the only replay value in this game is to get the best rating and time on each mission.The game is short, finished in few hours even tho I took my time, but definitely enjoyed the hours playing it and the feeling of money well spent is there!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
												A very enjoyable stealth puzzle game where you infiltrate high security buildings with subterfuge, violence, and electronic sabotage.  The game is short, but it manages to perfectly combine film noir, stealth and hacking into an enjoyable experience.  You are not forced to play one way or the other and you can eventually crash through doors and murder everyone if you want to.  Gunpoint isn't really punishing, but I did feel like I couldn't stop playing it until completion.  I then went and played it all again making some different choices along the way.  Thankfully the short story is not a major problem as the Steam Workshop allows countless custom levels and the level editor allows you to make your own.  I would describe it as more of a puzzle game with some humour and solid stealth mechanics thrown in.  I can only recommend this gem of an indie title and if you can get it on sale then it's definitely worth your time and money.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 24, 2014
												The shortest I can describe this game as: 2D Version (and better one) of Watch Dogs. You play as a trenchcoat wearing hacker who can manipulate anything in the power grid of the building, and infiltrates server rooms to hack them.I definitely recommend this game to any lover of strategy games. Very nice looking pixel graphics, fluid motions, nice ambiental music, but the most important aspect is the gameplay, which uses simple puzzle elements to create complex scenarios for you to complete - in any way you want. This game has a choose-your-own-style approach, where you can choose whether to be the stealthy spy that never leaves any mark behind, or the hardcore maniac who bashes doors in over his enemies. Time between missions are also entertaining, as before and after each mission you are texting with your employer. Some of them are quite fun to read.Another HUGE pro on the game's side is the simple and intuitive Level Editor, along with Workshop integration. Much like Portal 2, this game now gives you a virtually unlimited list of levels other players made for you to complete, so you don't need to replay the campaign over and over again.Achievement-wise, they are easy and fun to make. It took me about 5 hours to complete all 42 of them! Definitely a big recommendation for Achievement Hunters.All in all, this game is wonderful. Don't miss the chance to play it!

content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
												A really enjoyable stealth game, featuring system manipulation and pummeling people into bloody pulps. Comes with a fun level editor aswell and some community made level editors are more indepth and expand one's options.The stealth in and of itself is quite satisfying; I always get a kick out of demolishing every guard in the level, but you could do thing pacifisticly should you desire; it gives you alot of ways to approach problems. The level editor gives you even more flexibility to create ideal maps and the like.This is a stealth game I feel many people would feel comfortable with, and those familiar with the game can do some pretty neat things with the rewiring mechanics, which allow you to wire up different electronics to eachother and bamboozle guards.In terms of downsides, I'd say the single player is short, which is not necessarily a bad thing considering the plethora of levels workshop provides. I haven't really seen anything big in terms of bugs, either. I had alot of hype for this game, and it definitely delivered.

content:
Posted: April 28, 2015
												This game is just phenomenal! The story is very good even though it is quite short. The characters and the dialouges are funny and entertaining as you can pretty much always choose between 1-3 answers.This makes the story a little less linear. The gameplay is something different than the usual games. You can leap around with your Hyper-Trousers by holding the left mouse button and releasing it. By scrolling up on the mouse wheel you enter the 'Crosslink-mode'. In this mode you can rewire certain things for example, instead of turning on/off the light you can rewire the light switch to open/close a door or even fire off a gun by a patroling enemy. But there are different circuits with different colours. You can wire a red light switch to a red door but you can't wire a red light switch to a bue door. Pretty obvious, right? You can also buy/upgrade your gear to make things a little bit easier but also more interesting. You can solve the levels in many different ways depending on the gear that you have bought with the money you get from completing a level. The levels all work the same way. Get in the building hack one or more computers and leave without getting shot. You can do this stealthy and not kill anyone but you can also kill the guards and hack the computer without having to hope not to be seen. At least in the first few levels because as you advance in the story the buildings become bigger and the guards become more and stronger. But I don't want to spoil too much about the story as I think you should play it yourself. Another thing I really like about this game is the level editor and the Steam Workshop. The user-made levels can make you play the game even after finishing the story as there are so many and a lot are very good. Also the soundtrack of this game is just amazing but I suggest you listen to it yourself as it might not be the kind of music you like (opinions and stuff)!I excuse for any typos and want to thank you for reading! I hope this review might help you to decide if you want to buy this game.TL;DR: BUY THIS  GAME. BUY THIS GAME NOW.

content:
Posted: January 31, 2015
												Undenialbly one of the best games I have played in the past few years after its release.GunPoint is a 2D stealth action and puzzle game, which forces you to adapt to each induvidual level that it throws at you, you can also say it is hardcore in a way, as it only takes one hit for you to get killed by a security guard. The story, from my perspective anyway is cool. You play as Richard Conway, a freelance spy who is equipped with a special pair of trousers which allow him to jump at great lengths and to places where no person without them can go. Thats all i'll go for at the moment but some of the major plot points are seen in the early stages of the game. But here are some of the good things about the game.- Allows you to do any level the way you want to.- The soundtrack is really good, giving you that sense that you are playing a Noire-type of game- The Sneaky sections of the game are well done for a 2D oriented game.- It is also hardcore, meaning that you die in one hit from a gunshot, similar to the system in hotline miami.- The crosslink upgrade allows you to become a true hacker.- And finally the game has a lot of strategy behind the game, meaning that ou have to use your brain to figure out the best possible way to complete your objective.There are some Hicups i the game though that I would address;-The game is locked at 60 frames per second, meaning that your beast of a PC won't be able to boost out over 9000 frames per second on this game.-Some of the deaths of this game are kinda cheap, but thats probably just me.-And a few game setup issues (for me anyways) prevented the game from starting up.Overall score = 9.0/10 - Even though the game has a few negatives surrounding it, the positives far outweigh them, and its only for £6.00. for a far complete game that has a good chance of a sequel coming out in the future.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 1, 2015
												So having completed the game in almost 1 sitting of 3 hours, what would I rate this game?Well starting off I found the story began brilliantly, I enjoyed the witty humor and the way you could choose the responses you gave which had an effect on the way the story actually played out, I found though the story seemed a litle short for my liking, but the overall gameplay made up for this shortfall.Gameplay I found hilarious, being able to jump on enemies and punch them in the face repeatedly for no reason at all, jumping through windows from high up and landing on your face, and especially kicking doors into the faces of unspuspecting enemies had me laughing all the way through the gameplay.The mechanics of the game are fantastic, the way you can rewire things to your advantage to go uber sneaky or zapping the crap out of guards for the hell of it it, in the later levels providing a unique challenge that I havent seen in a game for a long time, it does get you thinking on how you can get through that door without being seen as well as then making it to the next one on a timer.With this in mind, I would highly recommend this game to anyone, even with its short story line I think it has replayability value, and with the workshop levels also there to provide another level of challenge - Gunpoint for me scores a solid 9.6/10.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25, 2015
												Hello there! Are you the average FPS/MOBA/RPG/RTS player who has just completed/got tired of a great AAA title and craves any kind of gaming break?Well, Gunpoint might just be the medicine for you. This well-designed platforming gem combines several of the things that a derided game we all know as Lookhounds (seriously Ubisoft, I'm coming for you) should have had in the first place. Aside from pretty neat hacking and movement mechanics, Gunpoint implements the one thing that is missing in most of all the games - smart humour. You'll be hooked in no time.All in all, Gunpoint stands as a unique and laid-back platformer, which I recommend to everyone who just wants to ward off the usual games and still have fun. Get it during a sale and you won't regret it.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 16, 2013
												This is very much a stealth and puzzle sort of game. While the puzzle aspect isn't apparent, moving through the levels stealthily in my mind makes it something you must think about and iI call it a puzzle. Plus you are armed with gadgets which you use to unlock electrical devices, and use them to connect switches to doors, lights, and other things. Every mission you must try and figure out how to get to the data you need, or whatever it is you are there for by bypassing the security systems of that building, and not getting killed by the guards. The game has great humor and the stealth aspects of finding clues, getting data, etc. make it a very fun and rewarding experience. You don't have to do it all stealthily, however. You can just run in and jump on guards and punch them in the face 1337 times as well. Of course this lowers your score for that particular mission as most of them require you to keep the violence to a minimum. The title of the game is a little misleading, as you actually rarely use a gun, and if you do it is a last resort. Like you only have one bullet, and you really don't want to be using it at all because it means you are seen and your score will lower. You can hold up enemies, but it is best to avoid them altogether. Definitely a game worth buying and a fun use of your mind. The game also includes a level creator  and Trading cards. you get 4 drops of 8 cards.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												Gunpoint is a very entertaining stealth/puzzle game in which you use your "Crosslink" gadget to rewire the electronics of buildings to get in, get to your objective and get out as stealthily - or unstealthily - as possible. You can rewire lighswitches, security cameras and other sensors to do whatever you want - confuse guards, unlock doors, turn off lights, etc...whatever you need to finish your objective. The open-ended gameplay is complimented by the humorous story and characters. The only problem with this game is that it felt a little on the short side to me, at 3 hours long. No worries though, as it's an excellent game while it lasts. Really great indie game.

												This game was definitely worth it! I tried out the demo and I was hooked. The goal of the game is to use stealth (and your brain) to capture or take out what ever your client wants you to. This game also lets you make many choices. It gives you options on what to say to your client, how to get the thing that they want (And yes, you can beat up guards and there is a gun that you can get in the upgrades store ;D). There are even gadgets! All in all, this game was really fun! The overall gameplay was short but there are DLCs to make your experience even longer :) 10/10

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2013
												Gunpoint is an action puzzle game designed, coded and written by PC Gamer journalist Tom Francis who just recently, after Gunpoint proved to be a success, left the publication to fully pursue a career in game development. And the world now has another talented independent developer.Gunpoint’s simple yet pleasing retro looks may fool you into thinking that the game is a throwback to times long past, but that couldn’t be farther from the truth. This is a wholly modern, unique and innovative game that rewards players for experimentation. The players assume the role of freelance spy Richard Conway who gets tangled up in a rather convoluted story of murder, betrayal and industrial espionage. The writing is great for the most part, it’s witty and often intentionally breaks the fourth wall. The noir atmosphere is surprisingly strong thanks to the great soundtrack and the pleasing aesthetics.Conway’s objective usually involves breaking into a building and retrieving sensitive data. To achieve this, the players are given complete freedom to choose whichever play style fits them best. Every mission can be completed without ever making a noise or being seen by the guards, but on the flipside, you can smash through windows, break down doors and simply kill everyone standing in your way. To do either, you earn upgrades for your newly acquired pants which allow you to jump over great heights and distances. You can also move on walls and ceilings. This allows for sneaking, but can also lead to all sorts of great action such as pouncing on a guard and knocking him out of the window.Conway can also purchase a variety of gadgets such as the Crosslink and Wirejack which introduces you to Gunpoint’s most compelling mechanic. By changing to an alternative view mode, you can rewire electric circuits. For example, you can rewire a light switch to open a door or a motion detector to turn off the lights. Later on, you can even purchase a gadget that allows you to rewire the guard’s weapons. This complete freedom of gameplay opens up numerous possibilities and the game never penalizes you for playing the way you want to play. Different clients will have different requests such as minimal violence or leaving no living witnesses, but these are completely optional objectives that only affect how the client rates you, but the mission will still be a success and you will get payed the same.The only major drawback is that the game is pretty short. It will definitely leave you craving for more content, but at least you can play all the missions again with all the gadgets and abilities you’ve unlocked which is compelling in its own way as it lets you further experiment with all the crazy stuff you can pull off.Gunpoint is an original and intelligent game that treats players with respect and facilitates emergent gameplay through the use of compelling, innovative and slick mechanics.8 OUT OF 10 (GREAT)
